intro: Psychotria hirtinervia, commonly known as the hairy-veined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent, hairy veins, which give it its common name. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and are clustered in cymes, often producing a sweet, fragrant scent. Psychotria hirtinervia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
